sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"害怕的，怕的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: afraid, fearful, awful, dreadful, frightful, terrible, horrible, terrific, appalling
means: afraid ：指由于胆小或怯懦而不敢说或做某事。
fearful ：普通用词，既指外界情况变化而引起的恐惧，又指来自内心的害怕与焦虑。
awful ：指威严得令人害怕或敬畏，有一定的感情色彩。
dreadful ：指使人非常恐惧，毛骨悚然，也使人感到讨厌而退缩。
frightful ：指使人陷入短暂的惊恐或产生毛骨悚然的感觉。
terrible ：侧重指给人以长久的惊骇，极端的恐怖，令人难以忍受。
horrible ：指因骇人听闻的丑恶而令人毛骨悚然，着重厌恶的成分多于害怕。
terrific ：多指外表、形状或力量等的可怕。
appalling ：指既令害怕又使人惊异、胆寒。

sentence.Network_en: She was afraid in a way that was quite new to her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她感到从未有过的害怕。

sentence.Network_en: "I'm afraid he's ill." — "I'm sorry to hear that."
Why should a great community like a university be afraid of nihilism?
sentence.Network_cn: 为什么像大学这样人才济济的社区要害怕虚无主义呢？

jx.jx_en_mean: [with clause]used to express polite or formal apology or regret
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用于礼貌或正式的道歉或表示遗憾]对不起，恐怕

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : past participle of the obsolete verb affray, from Anglo-Norman French afrayer (see affray)

entry.def: If you are afraid of someone or afraid to do something, you are frightened because you think that something very unpleasant is going to happen to you.

example.ex: She did not seem at all afraid...
I was afraid of the other boys...

entry.def: If you are afraid for someone else, you are worried that something horrible is going to happen to them.

example.ex: She's afraid for her family in Somalia.
example.tran: 她为身在索马里的家人担心。

entry.def: If you are afraid that something unpleasant will happen, you are worried that it may happen and you want to avoid it.

example.ex: I was afraid that nobody would believe me...
example.tran: 我担心没有人会相信我。

example.ex: The Government is afraid of losing the election...
example.tran: 现届政府担心会在选举中落败。

entry.tran: （用以道歉或婉转地提出异议）很抱歉，很遗憾，恐怕
entry.def: If you want to apologize to someone or to disagree with them in a polite way, you can say I'm afraid.

example.ex: We don't have anything like that, I'm afraid...
example.tran: 我们恐怕没有那样的东西。

example.ex: I'm afraid I can't help you...

means.word_mean: 2. filled with regret or concern; used often to soften an unpleasant statement;

sentences.sentence: "I'm afraid I won't be able to come"
"he was afraid he would have to let her go"

means.word_mean: 3. feeling worry or concern or insecurity;

sentences.sentence: "She was afraid that I might be embarrassed"
"I am afraid we have witnessed only the first phase of the conflict"

means.word_mean: 4. having feelings of aversion or unwillingness;

Sentence.sentence: She's afraid she won't be able to attend your class this afternoon though.
I'm afraid I can't come any earlier because I have three classes this afternoon
The author is afraid that the Obama administration will end up micromanaging America's economy.
They are afraid the normal social order will be paralyzed.
He is not afraid of challenge.
College faculty members are afraid that the pretext of moving students into the workforce might pose a threat to the core curriculum.

sentences.en: I am afraid I can't help you.
“Are you late?” “I am afraid so.”“你晚点了吗?

means.word_mean: 担忧, 忧虑;  担心（会发生某事）; 担心, 生怕（将发生不快、不幸或危险的事

sentences.en: The mother is very much afraid for her son who is seriously ill.
sentences.cn: 母亲很担心自己的儿子, 他病得很重。

jushi.english: It's hard to be afraid with you.You're a very reassuring person.
jushi.chinese: 和你在一起时我不感到畏惧,因为你能使人心安。
